intro: Coccoloba charitostachya, commonly known as the red mangrove or red mangrove tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America, typically found in coastal areas and mangrove swamps. The plant is characterized by its smooth, reddish bark and compound leaves that are often used in traditional medicine. It plays a vital role in stabilizing shorelines and providing habitat for various marine and terrestrial species. Its adaptability to saline environments makes it an important component of coastal ecosystems.
